name: Confédération Européenne des Organisations Nationales de la Boulangerie et de la Pâtisserie
goal: The small and medium-sized enterprises often experience that their needs are not taken into consideration at national or EU level when discussing regulations and policies concerning the Bakery and Confectionery craft. The minor majority of small and medium-sized enterprises are overrun by the major minority of food combines. CEBP ensures through its work that the European Bakery and Confectionery enterprises are heard in the European Commission and the European Parliament.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Consumer Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Food Safety, Internal Market, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
CEBP campaigns for all relevant policy issues in Europe, which are important for bakers and confectioners, like:

Allergen Labelling
Indication of the Country of Origin
Exceptions for Food Labelling
Regulation on Official Controls in the Food Chain
Traffic Light Labelling
Promotion of Agricultural Products
Nutrition Profiles / Salt
Acrylamides
